title: King Lathas

properties.value: King Lathas Ardignas is the king of East Ardougne, the capital of Kandarin. As the sons of King Ulthas, he and his younger brother Tyras are responsible for the division of the city between West and East.[1] Lathas rules the eastern part of the city, although the existence of the Ardougne City Council leaves the extent of his power uncertain. He and his brother are the great-grandsons of the first King of Kandarin, who founded the kingdom after the Great Battle, leading the Ardignas bloodline to rise to power.[2]

SMW Subobject for KingNPC location: Ardougne CastleUses infobox: NPCNPC ID: 8046, 8842, 9005, 11022Examine: King Lathas of East Ardougne.Release date: 23 October 2002Image: File:King Lathas.pngIs members only: trueIs variant of: King Lathas

King Lathas Ardignas is the king of East Ardougne, the capital of Kandarin. As the sons of King Ulthas, he and his younger brother Tyras are responsible for the division of the city between West and East.[1] Lathas rules the eastern part of the city, although the existence of the Ardougne City Council leaves the extent of his power uncertain. He and his brother are the great-grandsons of the first King of Kandarin, who founded the kingdom after the Great Battle, leading the Ardignas bloodline to rise to power.[2]

Contents

  • 1 History
    • 1.1 Early years
    • 1.2 Dealings with the Iorwerth Clan
    • 1.3 Plans with the Outpost
    • 1.4 Eliminating Iban
    • 1.5 Assassination of Tyras
    • 1.6 The threat of the Dragonkin
    • 1.7 Revolution, overthrowal and execution
  • 2 Family
  • 3 Dialogue
  • 4 Gallery (historical)
  • 5 References

History[edit | edit source]

Early years[edit | edit source]

Lathas was born some time in the second century of the Fifth Age to his father, King Ulthas. There are no details on his childhood available, but it is not unlikely that he spent it with the Royal Family in Ardougne.

In 132, King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table arrived to Gielinor from the realm of Britain and sought residence. The wealthy nobleman Lord Sinclair, in agreement with King Ulthas, granted them his own castle Camelot, while he and his family moved into a smaller mansion nearby, to his children's great dismay.[3] With King Arthur taking residence in Kandarin, Lathas would come to bear a deep hatred towards the knights of Camelot, although he kept this secret.

After their father died from a hunting accident four years later, Lathas and Tyras, both heirs to the throne, in accordance with their father's will, decided to split the city of Ardougne between them, dividing it in two parts.[1] Lathas became king of East Ardougne, which contained the famous market as well as a popular zoo. Meanwhile, King Tyras would soon depart on a journey to the other side of the Galarpos Mountains along with most of his army, leaving the ruling of West Ardougne in the hands of City Warder Bravek.

Dealings with the Iorwerth Clan[edit | edit source]

Some time after Tyras' departure, Lathas was contacted by the Iorwerth Clan, a malevolent family of elves who had started a civil war at the end of the Fourth Age and were now trying to return a mysterious entity known as the Dark Lord to RuneScape. In order to get a foothold in the human lands, the Iorwerths requested his aid in their plans, asking to be allowed access to West Ardougne, convincing the king that Lord Iban, a Kinshra officer who had been resurrected after dying in battle and taken over the Underground Pass, preventing it from being used to travel between Tirannwn and Kandarin, posed a serious threat. In return, they promised King Lathas to help him in the downfall of Camelot.[4]

West Ardougne was subsequently surrounded by a high and thick wall, thus completely isolating it from the outside world. The mourners kept the citizens believing in the plague by creating fake symptoms and even making Farmer Brumty's sheep outside the city look ill as well.[5] Even as the Death Guard discovered the Temple of Light beneath the mountains and began abducting alleged plague victims to use as mining slaves, King Lathas continued to keep up the hoax.[4]

Plans with the Outpost[edit | edit source]

In 169, King Lathas ordered the demolition of a historic Outpost north of West Ardougne, at the site where the Great Battle had taken place, in favour of his planned laboratory for a party of alchemists composed of Effigy, Transmute and Currency.[6] Its caretaker, a scholar named Jorral, asked for an adventurer's help in convincing Lathas to leave the building alone by uncovering its history.

They agreed to help and learnt of the history of the Outpost, Kandarin and the Ardignas bloodline by consulting various sources that Jorral had suggested. The latter proceeded to summarise the Outpost's history in a letter to the king, in addition to his plans to turn it into a museum, before asking the adventurer to deliver it to him. After reading the letter, King Lathas was impressed by the Outpost's historical value and agreed to have it become a museum.

Eliminating Iban[edit | edit source]

The restored Well of Voyage

Some time later, the East Ardougnese woman Elena, who had been regularly helping "plague victims" in the west, came close to discovering the plague did not exist. As a result, the mourners swiftly locked her in a secret prison. Her father Edmond subsequently enlisted an adventurer's help in rescuing her, the same as the one who had saved the Outpost, which they did successfully with the help of Bravek and the Rehnison family. Once Elena was safe, the adventurer helped her and her friend Guidor with the research, conclusively proving that the plague was fake.

The adventurer confronted King Lathas with this, who confessed that he had indeed lied about the plague. However, he told the adventurer that he was, in fact, protecting his people from a greater danger, stating that Tyras had been captured by the Dark Lord while in Tirannwn and subsequently forced to drink from the Chalice of Eternity, being corrupted and allying with the Dark Lord in the process.[7]

The adventurer believed this story, to which King Lathas tasked them with dispatching his own brother. First, they would need to gain access to the elven lands by clearing the Underground Pass. With the help of the guide Koftik, they learnt how to defeat Lord Iban after venturing through the Pass for a significant amount of time, and managed to destroy his soul by throwing a doll bearing the elements that had been used to resurrect him into the Well of the Damned. Lathas proceeded to send a couple of wizards to the ruins of Iban's Temple in order to remove his taint from the Well of the Damned, soon restoring the Well of Voyage, allowing access to the western lands once more.

Assassination of Tyras[edit | edit source]

After being informed that the Well of Voyage was fully operational once more, the king sent a messenger to the adventurer to inform them of this. Lathas asked them to venture to Tirannwn, make contact with the elves there and kill Tyras, whose camp was somewhere in the southern part of the Isafdar woods. They complied and journeyed through the Pass once more to find themselves in Tirannwn, where they were approached by Idris, an elf who was shocked to see a human. Idris was swiftly assassinated by two other elves, Essyllt and Morvran, who instructed the adventurer to find Lord Iorwerth in his camp, saying that King Lathas had informed them of their arrival.

King Tyras' tent engulfed in flames.

With some help from Iorwerth's tracker, the adventurer managed to locate King Tyras' encampment, hidden in the forest. His general, Hining, would not let them meet the busy king, however. Lord Iorwerth then suggested using an exceptionally volatile substance called fire oil to kill Tyras from afar and provided them with a book with instructions. The adventurer succeeded in creating such a bomb and launched it into the king's tent, causing a large explosion and killing Tyras on impact.

Lord Iorwerth gave them a sealed message to return to Lathas when the adventurer reported back, and gave them permission to use the Arandar pass over the mountains. Just outside Ardougne Castle, however, they were intercepted by Arianwyn, a cloaked elf who claimed to have seen all their actions and who unsealed the message for them. It informed Lathas that the path for the Dark Lord's return had been cleared with Tyras' death and that Camelot would soon fall. Arianwyn informed the adventurer that they would now serve as a spy on the inside for the rebel elves fighting the Iorwerths and advised them to deliver the message to Lathas to maintain his trust. The king was contented to receive the message, oblivious to the fact that they were aware of his betrayal.

The threat of the Dragonkin[edit | edit source]

King Lathas attended a meeting of political leaders at Varrock Castle, that was quickly orchestrated after an adventurer uncovered a forgotten Dragonkin stronghold on the island Lithkren, which contained a very vindictive Dragonkin named Zorgoth, who sought to destroy all of humankind using a powerful telepathic dragon, Galvek, to take control of the many dragons across Gielinor. King Lathas was there to represent Kandarin and sent both soldiers and equipment to help in the upcoming conflict.

Revolution, overthrowal and execution[edit | edit source]

King Lathas is captured by the Ardougne Resistance.

Tensions rose in the royal castle, when the young chemist Elena began to spread the word about the plague being fake. King Lathas had her imprisoned in the Ardougne Castle dungeon, but she was saved by an adventurer disguised as an Ardougne knight. Councillor Halgrive had however heard about the fake plague, and wanted to help overthrow King Lathas and helped forming a plan, where the adventurer disguised as a Mourner and an Ardougne Knight would turn public favour against the king, after which the adventurer led the Ardougne Resistance against the Mourners in West Ardougne, before leading them to the Ardougne Castle, where King Lathas's knights and paladins tried to fight them off. After successfully fighting the king's men back, King Lathas was found hiding in a wardrobe by some of the resistance fighters and brought out of the castle, where he revealed that he joined forces with Lord Iorwerth to get rid of his brother Tyras as well as King Arthur to unite the entire kingdom of Kandarin under his rule. Feeling that Saradomin had not listened to his prayers, he had turned to Zamorak, who he believed to be the Dark Lord. Lathas was then led away from the castle, and disgraced and dethroned he was brought to the Ardougne Market, where he was publicly executed in front of the people of Ardougne. His last words were a curse on all the attendants in the name of Zamorak.

The execution of King Lathas.

Having died with no apparent heir, his cousin Thoros is appointed as the new king of Kandarin.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Display Case 47, "Varrock Museum", Old School RuneScape. "5th Age - Year 136
    King Ulthas of Ardougne dies from an accidental arrow shot while out on a hunting expedition. Ardougne is left to his 2 sons, Tyras and Lathas who decide to split the city between them."
  2. ↑ Display Case 46, "Varrock Museum", Old School RuneScape. "One of the survivors of the great battle became king in year 98 of the 5th Age. His goal was to listen to the people's views and ensure a fair and equal life for everyone. He was the first of a line of kings in Ardougne that continues to this day under his great grandson, King Lathas of Ardougne, painted here."
  3. ↑ Display Case 9, "Varrock Museum", Old School RuneScape. "5th Age - Year 132
    King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table arrive on RuneScape in the year 132 of the 5th Age. Legend says they will return to Britain in its time of greatest need, so they're passing their time on RuneScape until then. King Ulthas saw them as good and rightful men who would do much good in the world, and granted them a large area of land to set up a new Camelot in north-east Kandarin."
  4. ↑ 4.0 4.1 Head Mourner, Old School RuneScape. "The original aim of the Death Guard was to secure a foothold in the east, in preparation for 'His' arrival. Now though our objective has become a little more...how should I put it...proactive. That fool King think we are here as his ally, we duped him into thinking that Iban was enough of a threat that he let us setup here. Lathas even thinks 'He' will help him dispose of the Knights of Camelot. The plague was actually fabricated by King Lathas', to justify the building of the city wall. But it has also worked in our favour too. We help him keep the people of Ardougne believing in the plague, but now after the discovery we have bigger fish to fry here."
  5. ↑ Head Mourner, "Mourning's End Part I", Old School RuneScape. "One of the things we do is keep the rumours of the plague active is to keep that old farmer Brumty believing his sheep are infected. The old half-wit thinks just because his sheep are an abnormal colour, that they are all ill with plague. It’s amazing what a bit of dye can do."
  6. ↑ Effigy, "Tower of Life", Old School RuneScape. "Do you know the outpost north of Ardougne? Well, the King was going to make that into an alchemy lab for us, but some fool ruined our plans!"
  7. ↑ King Lathas, "Biohazard", Old School RuneScape. "[It] protects them from a far greater danger, a fear too big to fathom. Their King, Tyras, journeyed out to the West on a voyage of discovery. But he was captured by the Dark Lord. The Dark Lord agreed to spare his life, but only on one condition... that he would drink from the Chalice of Eternity. The chalice corrupted him. He joined forces with the Dark Lord, the embodiment of pure evil, banished all those years ago... And so I erected this wall, not just to protect my people, but to protect all the people of Runescape. Now, with the King of West Ardougne, the Dark Lord has an ally on the inside."

rawContent:
{{External|rs|rsc}} {{Infobox NPC |version1 = King |version2 = Disgraced |name1 = King Lathas |name2 = Lathas |image1 = [[File:King Lathas.png|120px]] |image2 = [[File:Lathas.png|120px]] |release1 = [[23 October]] [[2002]] |release2 = [[25 July]] [[2019]] |update1 = Updates galore! |update2 = Song of the Elves |members = Yes |race = [[Human]] |quest1 = [[Biohazard]]
[[Underground Pass]]
[[Regicide]]
[[Making History]]
[[Song of the Elves]] |quest2 = [[Song of the Elves]] |location = [[Ardougne Castle]] |gender = Male |examine1 = King Lathas of East Ardougne. |examine2 = The disgraced king of East Ardougne. |map = {{Map|name=King Lathas|x=2579|y=3294|plane=1|r=4|mtype=square}} |id1 = 8046,8842,9005,11022 |id2 = 8843 }} {{Synced switch |version1=[[File:King Lathas chathead.png|left]] |version2=[[File:Lathas chathead.png|left]] }} '''King Lathas Ardignas''' is the king of [[East Ardougne]], the capital of [[Kandarin]]. As the sons of [[King Ulthas]], he and his younger brother [[Tyras]] are responsible for the division of the city between West and East.{{CiteNPC|quote = 5th Age - Year 136
King Ulthas of Ardougne dies from an accidental arrow shot while out on a hunting expedition. Ardougne is left to his 2 sons, Tyras and Lathas who decide to split the city between them.|npc = Display case{{!}}Display Case 47|loc = Varrock Museum|name = divide}} Lathas rules the eastern part of the city, although the existence of the Ardougne City Council leaves the extent of his power uncertain. He and his brother are the great-grandsons of the first King of Kandarin, who founded the kingdom after the Great Battle, leading the Ardignas bloodline to rise to power.{{CiteNPC|quote = One of the survivors of the great battle became king in year 98 of the 5th Age. His goal was to listen to the people's views and ensure a fair and equal life for everyone. He was the first of a line of kings in Ardougne that continues to this day under his great grandson, King Lathas of Ardougne, painted here.|npc = Display case{{!}}Display Case 46|loc = Varrock Museum}} {{Clear|left}} ==History== ===Early years=== Lathas was born some time in the second century of the [[Fifth Age]] to his father, [[King Ulthas]]. There are no details on his childhood available, but it is not unlikely that he spent it with the Royal Family in [[Ardougne]]. In 132, [[King Arthur]] and his [[Knights of the Round Table]] arrived to [[Gielinor]] from the realm of [[Britain]] and sought residence. The wealthy nobleman [[Lord Sinclair]], in agreement with King Ulthas, granted them his own castle [[Camelot]], while he and his family moved into a [[Sinclair Mansion|smaller mansion]] nearby, to his children's great dismay.{{CiteNPC|quote = 5th Age - Year 132
King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table arrive on RuneScape in the year 132 of the 5th Age. Legend says they will return to Britain in its time of greatest need, so they're passing their time on RuneScape until then. King Ulthas saw them as good and rightful men who would do much good in the world, and granted them a large area of land to set up a new Camelot in north-east Kandarin.|npc = Display case{{!}}Display Case 9|loc = Varrock Museum}} With King Arthur taking residence in Kandarin, Lathas would come to bear a deep hatred towards the knights of Camelot, although he kept this secret. After their father died from a hunting accident four years later, Lathas and Tyras, both heirs to the throne, in accordance with their father's will, decided to split the city of Ardougne between them, dividing it in two parts.{{NamedRef|divide}} Lathas became king of East Ardougne, which contained the famous [[Ardougne Market|market]] as well as a [[Ardougne Zoo|popular zoo]]. Meanwhile, King Tyras would soon depart on a journey to the other side of the [[Galarpos Mountains]] along with most of his army, leaving the ruling of West Ardougne in the hands of City Warder [[Bravek]]. ===Dealings with the Iorwerth Clan=== Some time after Tyras' departure, Lathas was contacted by the [[Iorwerth Clan]], a malevolent family of [[elves]] who had started a [[Elven Civil War|civil war]] at the end of the [[Fourth Age]] and were now trying to return a mysterious entity known as the [[Dark Lord]] to RuneScape. In order to get a foothold in the human lands, the Iorwerths requested his aid in their plans, asking to be allowed access to West Ardougne, convincing the king that [[Lord Iban]], a [[Kinshra]] officer who had been resurrected after dying in battle and taken over the [[Underground Pass (dungeon)|Underground Pass]], preventing it from being used to travel between Tirannwn and Kandarin, posed a serious threat. In return, they promised King Lathas to help him in the downfall of Camelot.{{CiteNPC|npc = Head Mourner|quote = The original aim of the Death Guard was to secure a foothold in the east, in preparation for 'His' arrival. Now though our objective has become a little more...how should I put it...proactive. That fool King think we are here as his ally, we duped him into thinking that Iban was enough of a threat that he let us setup here. Lathas even thinks 'He' will help him dispose of the Knights of Camelot. The plague was actually fabricated by King Lathas', to justify the building of the city wall. But it has also worked in our favour too. We help him keep the people of Ardougne believing in the plague, but now after the discovery we have bigger fish to fry here.|name = hm}} [[West Ardougne]] was subsequently surrounded by a high and thick wall, thus completely isolating it from the outside world. The mourners kept the citizens believing in the plague by creating fake symptoms and even making [[Farmer Brumty]]'s [[Sick-looking sheep|sheep]] outside the city look ill as well.{{CiteNPC|npc = Head Mourner|loc = Mourning's End Part I|quote = One of the things we do is keep the rumours of the plague active is to keep that old farmer Brumty believing his sheep are infected. The old half-wit thinks just because his sheep are an abnormal colour, that they are all ill with plague. It’s amazing what a bit of dye can do.}} Even as the Death Guard discovered the [[Temple of Light]] beneath the mountains and began abducting alleged plague victims to use as mining slaves, King Lathas continued to keep up the hoax.{{NamedRef|hm}} ===Plans with the Outpost=== In 169, King Lathas ordered the demolition of a historic [[Outpost]] north of West Ardougne, at the site where the Great Battle had taken place, in favour of his planned laboratory for a party of alchemists composed of [[Effigy]], [['Transmute' The Alchemist|Transmute]] and [['Currency' The Alchemist|Currency]].{{CiteNPC|npc = Effigy{{!}}Effigy|loc = Tower of Life|quote = Do you know the outpost north of Ardougne? Well, the King was going to make that into an alchemy lab for us, but some fool ruined our plans!}} Its caretaker, a scholar named [[Jorral]], asked for an adventurer's help in convincing Lathas to leave the building alone by uncovering its history. They agreed to help and learnt of the history of the Outpost, [[Kandarin]] and the Ardignas bloodline by consulting various sources that Jorral had suggested. The latter proceeded to summarise the Outpost's history in a letter to the king, in addition to his plans to turn it into a museum, before asking the adventurer to deliver it to him. After reading the letter, King Lathas was impressed by the Outpost's historical value and agreed to have it become a museum. ===Eliminating Iban=== [[File:Well of Voyage.gif|thumb|left|120px|The restored Well of Voyage]] Some time later, the [[East Ardougne]]se woman [[Elena]], who had been regularly helping "plague victims" in the west, came close to discovering the plague did not exist. As a result, the mourners swiftly locked her in a secret prison. Her father [[Edmond]] subsequently enlisted an adventurer's help in rescuing her, the same as the one who had saved the Outpost, which they did successfully with the help of [[Bravek]] and the Rehnison family. Once Elena was safe, the adventurer helped her and her friend [[Guidor]] with the research, conclusively proving that the plague was fake. The adventurer confronted King Lathas with this, who confessed that he had indeed lied about the plague. However, he told the adventurer that he was, in fact, protecting his people from a greater danger, stating that Tyras had been captured by the [[Dark Lord]] while in Tirannwn and subsequently forced to drink from the [[Chalice of Eternity]], being corrupted and allying with the Dark Lord in the process.{{CiteNPC|npc = Lathas{{!}}King Lathas|loc = Biohazard|quote = [It] protects them from a far greater danger, a fear too big to fathom. Their King, Tyras, journeyed out to the West on a voyage of discovery. But he was captured by the Dark Lord. The Dark Lord agreed to spare his life, but only on one condition... that he would drink from the Chalice of Eternity. The chalice corrupted him. He joined forces with the Dark Lord, the embodiment of pure evil, banished all those years ago... And so I erected this wall, not just to protect my people, but to protect all the people of Runescape. Now, with the King of West Ardougne, the Dark Lord has an ally on the inside.}} The adventurer believed this story, to which King Lathas tasked them with dispatching his own brother. First, they would need to gain access to the elven lands by clearing the [[Underground Pass (dungeon)|Underground Pass]]. With the help of the guide [[Koftik]], they learnt how to defeat [[Lord Iban]] after venturing through the Pass for a significant amount of time, and managed to destroy his soul by throwing a [[doll of Iban|doll]] bearing the elements that had been used to resurrect him into the Well of the Damned. Lathas proceeded to send a couple of [[wizard]]s to the ruins of [[Iban's Temple]] in order to remove his taint from the Well of the Damned, soon restoring the [[Well of Voyage]], allowing access to the western lands once more. ===Assassination of Tyras=== After being informed that the Well of Voyage was fully operational once more, the king sent a [[King's messenger|messenger]] to the adventurer to inform them of this. Lathas asked them to venture to Tirannwn, make contact with the elves there and kill [[Tyras]], whose camp was somewhere in the southern part of the [[Isafdar]] woods. They complied and journeyed through the Pass once more to find themselves in Tirannwn, where they were approached by [[Idris]], an elf who was shocked to see a human. Idris was swiftly assassinated by two other elves, [[Essyllt]] and [[Morvran]], who instructed the adventurer to find [[Lord Iorwerth]] in his [[Iorwerth Camp|camp]], saying that King Lathas had informed them of their arrival. [[File:Regicide - Regicide.png|thumb|King Tyras' [[Burning tent (Regicide)|tent engulfed in flames]].]] With some help from Iorwerth's [[Elf Tracker|tracker]], the adventurer managed to locate [[Tyras Camp|King Tyras' encampment]], hidden in the forest. His general, [[General Hining|Hining]], would not let them meet the busy king, however. Lord Iorwerth then suggested using an exceptionally volatile substance called [[barrel bomb|fire oil]] to kill Tyras from afar and provided them with a [[Big book of bangs|book with instructions]]. The adventurer succeeded in creating such a bomb and launched it into the king's tent, causing a large explosion and killing Tyras on impact. Lord Iorwerth gave them a [[Iorwerth's message|sealed message]] to return to Lathas when the adventurer reported back, and gave them permission to use the [[Arandar]] pass over the mountains. Just outside [[Ardougne Castle]], however, they were intercepted by [[Arianwyn]], a cloaked elf who claimed to have seen all their actions and who unsealed the message for them. It informed Lathas that the path for the Dark Lord's return had been cleared with Tyras' death and that Camelot would soon fall. Arianwyn informed the adventurer that they would now serve as a spy on the inside for the rebel elves fighting the Iorwerths and advised them to deliver the message to Lathas to maintain his trust. The king was contented to receive the message, oblivious to the fact that they were aware of his betrayal. ===The threat of the Dragonkin=== King Lathas attended a meeting of political leaders at [[Varrock Castle]], that was quickly orchestrated after an adventurer uncovered a forgotten Dragonkin stronghold on the island [[Lithkren]], which contained a very vindictive [[Dragonkin]] named [[Zorgoth]], who sought to destroy all of humankind using a powerful telepathic dragon, [[Galvek]], to take control of the many dragons across Gielinor. King Lathas was there to represent [[Kandarin]] and sent both soldiers and equipment to help in the upcoming conflict. ===Revolution, overthrowal and execution=== [[File:Song of the Elves - the King falls.png|thumb|left|King Lathas is captured by the Ardougne Resistance.]] Tensions rose in the royal castle, when the young chemist [[Elena]] began to spread the word about the plague being fake. King Lathas had her imprisoned in the Ardougne Castle dungeon, but she was saved by an adventurer [[Ardougne knight armour|disguised]] as an Ardougne knight. [[Councillor Halgrive]] had however heard about the fake plague, and wanted to help overthrow King Lathas and helped forming a plan, where the adventurer disguised as a Mourner and an Ardougne Knight would turn public favour against the king, after which the adventurer led the Ardougne Resistance against the Mourners in West Ardougne, before leading them to the Ardougne Castle, where King Lathas's knights and paladins tried to fight them off. After successfully fighting the king's men back, King Lathas was found hiding in a wardrobe by some of the resistance fighters and brought out of the castle, where he revealed that he joined forces with [[Lord Iorwerth]] to get rid of his brother Tyras as well as [[King Arthur]] to unite the entire kingdom of Kandarin under his rule. Feeling that [[Saradomin]] had not listened to his prayers, he had turned to [[Zamorak]], who he believed to be the [[Dark Lord]]. Lathas was then led away from the castle, and disgraced and dethroned he was brought to the [[Ardougne Market]], where he was publicly executed in front of the people of Ardougne. His last words were a curse on all the attendants in the name of Zamorak. [[File:Song of the Elves - the King's death.png|thumb|The execution of King Lathas.]] Having died with no apparent heir, his cousin [[King Thoros|Thoros]] is appointed as the new king of Kandarin. ==Family== {{Family tree Ardignas}} {{Succession|predecessor=[[King Ulthas]]|title='''King of [[Kandarin]]'''|successor=[[King Thoros]]}} ==Dialogue== {{Hastranscript|npc}} ==Gallery (historical)== King Lathas (2003).png|Appearance during the RuneScape 2 beta ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Biohazard}} {{Underground Pass}} {{Regicide}} {{Dragon Slayer II}} {{Making History}} {{Song of the Elves}} {{East Ardougne}} {{Rulers}} [[Category:Zamorakians]]
